body_html: It is well defined. You could apply an identity function to y and it would be equivalent to a common use case of torch.autograd.backward. I suspect that we're adding all the grad_fns of Variables given to backward to the ready queue, even if they should wait for part of the graph to be computed.
body_text: It is well defined. You could apply an identity function to y and it would be equivalent to a common use case of torch.autograd.backward. I suspect that we're adding all the grad_fns of Variables given to backward to the ready queue, even if they should wait for part of the graph to be computed.
body: It is well defined. You could apply an identity function to `y` and it would be equivalent to a common use case of `torch.autograd.backward`. I suspect that we're adding all the grad_fns of Variables given to `backward` to the `ready` queue, even if they should wait for part of the graph to be computed.
